ACT
77
Violation of the value of a necessary part
The necessary part is violated when the total value of the disposition of the will and/or the value of the gifts is so great that because of it the necessary heir would not receive the full value of his necessary part (Article 70, paragraph 5).
When determining the total value of testamentary dispositions and gifts, those gifts and dispositions by will that the testator ordered not to be included in the necessary heir's inheritance are also taken into account.
